Description: Fragment of a pottery wheel-made lamp with one surviving short, blunt and burnt nozzle and the inscription: "...to the Dioskouroi" scratched into the narrow incurved rim.Red brown Nile silt with a grey core and abundant mica, white and organic inclusions.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hellenion (Naukratis), south-west corner, just south of 'Dioscuri chamber' Site 34 (Hogarth)
Curator's comments: Discovered in 1899 by Hogarth in the south-western part of the Hellenion, i.e. the part of the Hellenion closest to the sanctuary of the Dioskouroi: "The first point at which any considerable find of inscriptions was made, was at 34, where in the corner of a small chamber abutting west on the great enclosure wall, which runs north, a number of dedications to the Dioscuri were discovered about 2 ft. above the mud. Just south of the southern wall of this small chamber and at a similar level occurred the lamp with Dioscuri dedication (No. 57); and south again of this, up to the line of the E.-W. enclosure wall, were found (scattered partly on the surface in sebakh-diggers' and rubbish heaps, partly a foot or two above the mud) a few dedications to Herakles (Nos. 33, 84), mixed with stray sherds of Apollo (No. 52), Artemis? (No. 65), and others not to be identified, including the inscribed stone horse (No. 58), which like two other horses found by the sebakh-diggers close to this same point, lay in untouched earth almost immediately upon the mud." (Hogarth et al. 1898-9, p. 30).

The fabric is consistent with Nile Delta silt and the form and inscription suggest local production at Naukratis. Inscription incised before firing (Johnston 2008, 116 and 120 fig. 3). Parallel from Olynthos (see Bailey 1977, 243). Johnston, A. 2008. Some fictile biographies from Naukratis, in D.C. Kurtz (ed.), 'Essays in Classical Archaeology for Eleni Hatzivassiliou'. Oxford.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q513)
Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (no. 57)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 700, no. 580)
Walters 1914 / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Lamps in the British Museum (159)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KC.31) (Phase 1)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School at Athens
